messages: In Strenilla SMP: Killing a player grants +1 Strength. Dying loses you -1 Strength!
Stuck at Strength 0? Hunt for a Mace in a Trial Chamber to turn the tide of any fight.
Crouch-walking on Wool prevents the Warden from hearing you in the Deep Dark.
Turn Mud into Clay by placing it on a block with Pointed Dripstone underneath.
The Mace deals more damage the further you fall—it can potentially one-shot any mob.
Wind Charges launch you into the air; use them to safely escape or reset fall damage.
Feeding a Frog a small Magma Cube causes it to drop a colorful, glowing Froglight.
Taming an Allay with a Cookie lets you give it an item to find and collect for you.
Ominous Bottles trigger 'Trial Omen,' turning standard spawners into high-tier challenges.
In Strenilla, your Strength is your life. Watch your back—others are hunting your points!
The Mace's 'Density' enchantment increases the bonus damage dealt for every block fallen.
Use 'Wind Burst' on a Mace to bounce back into the air after a successful smash attack.
Potions of Infestation give a 10% chance to spawn Silverfish whenever the entity takes damage.
Drinking a Potion of Oozing causes an entity to spawn two Slimes upon its death.
Weaving Potions allow entities to move through Cobwebs faster and spawn them when they die.
A Potion of Wind Charged causes an entity to release a wind burst explosion when it perishes.
Trial Chamber 'Vaults' can be opened once per player—don't forget your Trial Key!
Breeding two Frogs with Slimeballs creates 'Frogspawn' which must hatch in water.
You can shear a Bogged skeleton to make it drop mushrooms and reveal its mossy head.
Placing a Mob Head on a Note Block allows the Note Block to play that mob's ambient sound.
The Recovery Compass only works in the dimension where you last died.
Sniffers find 'Ancient Seeds' like Torchflowers that don't grow naturally in the world.
Trial Spawners scale rewards based on the number of players nearby—bring a team!
Wind Charges can activate buttons, levers, and trapdoors from a distance.
Applying a Honeycomb to a Sign (Waxing) prevents anyone from editing the text further.
The Breeze is immune to projectiles; you must use melee or reflected Wind Charges.
Mangrove Propagules can be planted and grown underwater unlike most other saplings.
Camels are tall enough that Zombies and Creepers cannot reach you while you are riding.
Chiseled Bookshelves output a Redstone signal based on the last book slot you touched.
Tadpoles grow into different Frog colors based on the temperature of their biome.
Copper Bulbs have a unique delay when toggling, based on their current oxidation level.
Scrape oxidized Copper blocks with an Axe to return them to their shiny orange state.
The 'Swift Sneak' enchantment is an Ancient City exclusive and lets you crouch at walking speed.
Echo Shards are rare loot from Ancient Cities used specifically to craft Recovery Compasses.
Armor Trims are purely cosmetic—they show off your rarest loot to other players.
Vaults in Trial Chambers give every player unique loot; you don't have to share the reward!
The Crafter block can automate any recipe when powered by a Redstone pulse.
To find the End Gateway easily, turn your brightness to 'Moody' to spot the light source.
Horses and Camels no longer sink in water while being ridden by a player.
Netherite Horse Armor provides 19 armor points and is crafted at a Smithing Table.
Tamed Nautilus can be mounted with a Saddle and grant 'Breath of the Nautilus' effects.
Zombies and Piglins now have a chance to spawn wielding a high-reach Spear.
Spears have two attacks: a quick Jab and a high-damage, view-velocity based Charge.
Camel Husks are a new undead variant that spawn in Deserts at 0 light level.
Hoppers have a short cooldown after being moved by a Piston to prevent duplication bugs.
Cloud movement is now synchronized across all players on a server.
Items no longer 'bob' in your hand when their durability changes from damage or Mending.
You can rebind debug keys (F3 features) in the new Debug category of the Key Binds screen.
Environmental Fog in the Nether is no longer tied to your render distance setting.
The color of sunrises and sunsets is now dynamically affected by rain and thunder.
